name: Sun Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, I want to thank trip advisor and all of you for having me so well informed well before our 15th Anniversary trip to Cancun.
reviews.title: Absolute perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: GOGO travel's reps in Cancun is Olympus tours and they are out of this world for keeping you clear of the time shares and in the middle of great times. They do exactly as they promise. Thanks Victor. Oh and speaking of the time share, we went through the check in deal at the Sun Palace because you need to do this if you want to go on the free tours or Wet and Wild. You do not have to do the time share if you don't want and still get any of the free tours they promote. We decided to do the 2 hour presentation knowing we would not become members. They were completely kind and courteous and did not push us at all. It was a 8 to 10 am trip to Cancun Palace. You listened to the speel and then they gave you what they promised and a voucher for a cab ride back to Sun Palace. For our trouble we received 2 free royal swim with dolphins at Wet n Wild (unbelievable experience) Quick note get the $50 dvd after and grab your own stills after. The $20 pics are just that. We also received a $100 palace cash to spend with Olympus tours. (We did parasailing with Aquaworld. Also completely proffessional and exillerating.) and two t-shirts. All in all about $425 worth off free stuff. That was worth 2 hours of my time. Totally up to you.
reviews.title: Romantic and relaxing week at a wonderful resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sun was out of this world. We ate at the Italian 2 nights. This is a very romantic dinner. Sax guy playing and treated like royalty. The food was really good as well. I recomend going after dark to get the full experience. The steak is not that great. Not bad just wished we had tried the Mexican instead. You have to make reservations one night for the Hibachi at the Cancun Palace. This was a very cool experience. I would make reservations at least one day ahead. We waited till the same day and barely got in. The breakfast buffet is great as well as the lunch buffet. You have to try the made to order pizzas by the pool grill. These were the best.
reviews.title: Can't Wait to Go Back !!!!

likes.liked: — The service at the hotel is EXCELLENT.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't reccomend the party hopper because they don't go to coco bongo anymore. It is a very good deal because they set you up with someone who fetch's drinks all night long. The only problem is The City is nothing at all compared to CoCo Bongo. We went to CoCo Bongo the next night and it was mind blowing performances. The only thing is you need to figure out how to get a reserved seat. We were mashed into the masses and got more beer spilled on us than we were able to drink. (which was about two a piece because thats all we could manage to get our hands on) If we were at a table it would have been a million times better plus they serve you like the party hopper. Senior Frogs is very cool too (second stop on party hopper)
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The entertainment staff was excellent. They work so hard to keep you having fun. We played lots of silly games and volleyball if this is for you. If not their were even more areas to just relax and unwind if this is not for you. Aron and Claudia thank you for keeping us laughing the entire time. Just one warning most of the nightly entertainment is fairly burlesque. This was still tastefully done but burlesque. We really enjoyed it but once again this is your personal preference (this is a couples only resort)
reviews.title: One more great review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here in May 2008(review a little late) with my boyfriend for one week. We booked the hotel through the website itself. If possible I would suggest not arriving to Cancun airport on a Saturday it is a nightmare and took 3 hours to get through immigration. That aside onto the resort.
reviews.title: Wonderful All Inclusive Resort with Awesome Beach!

likes.liked: — The beach and using all the Palace Resorts facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is beautiful. Very clean, simple lines and adult in decor. Our room was well done and comfortable. Maid service was good. The only thing is that if someone next to you has the television on loud you will hear it since they are mounted on the wall. The balcony was nice but not while the sun was out(you could dry clothing really quickly though!)
reviews.title: Sun Palace is Awesome!!

likes.disliked: — Can't think of a single thing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dinners at Sun Palace ranged from ok(Mexican) to really good(The Steak). I have never had to many tenderloins before! The Asian restaurant on the top of the building is really relaxing with low lighting and soft music. They also have decent sushi. Very relaxing. The breakfasts were excellent and they have everything you could want from omlettes, mexican specialties, plenty of fruit, smoothies, Bloody Mary's, Mimosas and nice strong coffee.
reviews.title: Palace Resorts always aim to please!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a couple of excursions through the hotel itself. The first was parasailing. This was done at the Cancun Palace Beach. Very fun and not too expensive. The second tour we did was the Tulum/XpuHa Palace excursion.
reviews.title: Great Hotel...Great People.....great Vacation!

likes.liked: — The sun...the beach and the people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The air conditioned bus picked us up in front of the hotel. We picked up others along the hotel zone and we were off. Tulum is very beautiful. The beach there is amazing in color. Our guide informed us all about the different landmarks and he was really great. His name was Pancho. It is HOT there. Be sure to bring comfortable shoes and some water. The bar there is nice just be sure to pay your bill as you leave. We had paid when we received our drinks there and then in about 20 minutes the waitstaff convinced the manager that we were trying to stiff the joint and hadn't paid. We had to have fellow tour passengers attest that we had indeed paid our tab. It was a little hairy there for a minute. We also stopped at a local Mayan market. They had some beautiful jewelry and handmade items. They only take cash so make sure to bring some along and they will barter. They are not real pushy either which is nice.
reviews.title: "Sun" believable Vacation!

likes.liked: — Adults only, quiet location, best beach, service, everything!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our honeymoon of 6 night/7days through allinclusiveoutlet.com. We ordered a Junior Suite and signed up for the Romance package. Overall, we had an amazing honeymoon!
reviews.title: Wonderful Honeymoon!

likes.liked: — Spacious and clean rooms, beautiful beach, hard working staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival: Thanks to American Airlines we were delayed 5 hours so we didn't arrive at Sun Palace until 10:30PM. Since we were so late, we did not receive the champagne and carnation like a lot of the other reviewers did. We also didn't have to deal with any timeshare people. The front desk staff was very cheery and gave us a grand welcome to Sun Palace. One of the employees took our luggage up to our room for us and showed us how to use the safe, hot tub and lighting.
reviews.title: Best Sevice in the World

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: I don't really know what the difference between a regular room was and a junior suite. However, our junior suite had a lovely view of the beach and a nice little balcony. The hot tub was situated down 2 steps from the king sized bed. The mini bar had a variety of sodas and alcoholic beverages. You can request more if you run out just by calling up the room service at any time.
reviews.title: Sun Palace Exceeded Our Expectations

likes.disliked: — food is good but could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The floor can get really slippery from the humidity so you have to be sure to keep your sliding door closed and keep a card in the switch so that the room stays air conditioned.
reviews.title: Anniversary Trip to Sun Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the bathroom to be a little strange. The toilet is in it's own little room and it felt like a chamber. It echoed throughout the whole room. The two vanity sinks are right outside the bathroom. The shower was nice and large with a seat and comes with all the amenities you need.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked my trip to the Sun Palace with Vacation Express a travel company I have used many times and not once had a problem. My girlfriend and I are in our mid forties. I have been to Cancun previously 5 times this was her first. So I wanted a resort that would be nice. I stumbled upon trip advisor and read many reviews of other hotels before selecting Sun Palace. The positive far out weighed the negitative from what I read. We both had a great time! The hotel was very clean both inside and out there was always someone cleaning. Our room was #608 it had a corner balcony and it had a great view. The room itself was always very clean they cleaned it twice a day. We liked everything about it. From the fine linens on the bed the free liquor dispenser and mini bar and free 24 hour room service. when we went May 18th - 24th it even included free phone service to cell phones in the U.S. Now to the service it was also excellent they would do anything they could to make you happy. Service was A+++
reviews.title: Sun Palace A Great Place

likes.disliked: — Little night life, Service sometimes slow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: It was very good we did not eat in all the restaurants but what we tried was good as far as all inclusive goes. Even if you do not see what you want if they can they will make it for you.
reviews.title: Plenty of Margaritas and NO Kids!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Activities: If you want to be constantly entertained this may not be the place for you. I was ok with it but someone who wants great shows or danceing may be disappointed. I' ve experianced wild and crazy in Cancun so a hotel a little on the quite side was ok with me.
reviews.title: GREAT Honeymoon at Sun Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach: This was one of the best things about Sun Palace its large clean pleanty of chairs and more umbrellas than any hotel I've seen. Servers wait on you at your chair. Beware of the surf it can be rough at times.
reviews.title: Good Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Drinks: The alcohol at Sun Palace was the best I've seen for all inclusive they served top shelf liquor. ( Ask for it or they use well) If you like rum try a Dirty Monkey & Mudslide they where great
reviews.title: Exceeded my EXPECTATIONS!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful honeymoon at the Sun Palace. We loved the beach, the service was excellent, and the room was beautifully appointed. The staff was always cleaning, and the entire property was spotless. We stayed over New Year's, and although the hotel was at one point about 90% full, it never felt crowded. We never had to wait at the restaurants, and often we were one of three or four couples there at a meal. They also do a great job making honeymooners feel special (sparkling wine, special dinner, upgraded room, etc.). We mostly spent our time on the beach, and we took one of the included tours to Tulum, which was fun.
reviews.title: Great honeymoon

likes.liked: — Great beach, lovely facility, excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give an excellent rating was that my husband got food poisoning one evening. He's pretty sure his steak was undercooked that night. It didn't last too long, and we don't really blame the hotel, but we would have preferred that it didn't happen at all. The next night, he again ordered a steak (brave man) and it was again undercooked, so he just ordered something else to be safe.
reviews.title: The Place to Stay in Cancun

likes.liked: — the beach, convenience to airport, getting to use the other resorts
likes.disliked: — lack of afternoon sun at resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: Other than that, the food was anywhere from OK to quite good. I'm a pretty bland eater, and I usually just find something I like and order it over and over again, so I was perfectly happy. You also have the option to go to other resorts for food, if you want.
reviews.title: not worth the money-RIPP OFF

likes.liked: — guest service that listened at least

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great all-inclusive hotel and the best choice for a stay in Cancun.
reviews.title: FABULOUS!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The last time I had been in Cancun was in 1999 and it is such a shame that the beach is no longer nearly as nice- the hurricanes have really taken their toll. Sun Palace, which is closer to the airport and near the end of the strip, however, has a fantastic beach. If you are a beach person (and I definitely am) the Sun Palace is the best hotel in Cancun for that reason alone- the beach is still wide with no rocks.
reviews.title: Great but.......

likes.liked: — Staff, cleanliness and all inclusive features
likes.disliked: — Noise in halls and bad shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let me begin by saying that anyone who has written a bad review regarding this hotel could not have stayed at the Sun Palace. I read a lot of reviews and could not believe that people were so positive that this place was excellent. I guess you could say that I wanted to read the negative just to have a realistic perspective on the real Sun Palace.
reviews.title: I Love The Sun Palace

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sun Palace is just what it says a PALACE. Me and my wife went on our anniversary and let me say we do not travel a lot so I had no clue on where to stay but because of the good reviews that other people posted for this hotel made our anniversary a success. Looking at pictures for this hotel does it know justice: marble floors, fountains, clean bathrooms, polite people, and a fantastic room if that is not what you are looking for you probably need to stay somewhere else. The only thing that I can say about this hotel is WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It would probably take me days to tell you all the good things about this hotel and one word to tell you about the negative (NONE!) we will be back.
reviews.title: Another great Palace Resort!

likes.liked: — all-inclusive, friendly staff, free international calling

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sun Palace from May 17-22 for our anniversary. We had previously stayed at the Aventura Spa Palace on our honeymoon and enjoyed it so much that we thought we'd try out one of the other locations.
reviews.title: Great package deal for an all-inclusive resort!!!

likes.liked: — all inclusive resort that's truly all-inclusive!

reviews.title: The Sun Palace is fabulous!
reviews.text: This hotel is in the southern part of the hotel zone and one of the first stops from the airport. If you want to go shopping or to any restaurants outside this hotel, you'll need to take a taxi or bus. We took the public bus which is only 6.5 pesos per person (65 cents). And, if you like shopping, we enjoyed La Isla Mall.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you arrive, be aware of the "time share" people lined up on your right. They are not rude about it, but it is annoying.
reviews.title: Sun Palace was fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Once again, we had a fabulous vacation. The hugs and genuine warmth they expressed when seeing us again was nothing short of amazing. We really felt like we were with family.
reviews.title: Sun Palace - Better Than Ever

likes.liked: — The size of the room, the jacuzzi, everyhing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just when we thought Sun Palace couldn't get better - it did!!!
reviews.title: Best vacation to date
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: 1) The champagne is better. They introduced it at the Oriental Lounge bar the week we were there - not as sweet - and of better quality. That was a nice surprise. I hope they keep it available to those who prefer it in the future.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) They now have a complete outdoor buffet by the main pool every day. There is a BBQ area where you can get anything from chicken, steak, tuna, pork chops, cheeseburgers and hot dogs. On Sunday they even had grilled shrimp and prawns. The separate fish grill where you can get delicious grouper, salmon, mahi-mahi and calamari was very popular. (The grouper was fantastic) Not to mention a personal pizza station and many side dishes to choose from.
reviews.title: Wonderful Trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course, you could also get take-out containers from the indoor buffet if you preferred something there, and take it to the pool or your room.
reviews.title: JUST OKAY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I celebrated our 37th wedding anniversary at this facility. He has had a stroke, and uses a wheelchair or a cane to get around. We wanted a small property that was fairly accessible. We were not disappointed. The hotel is compact, and I could get him anywhere... except the beach without much problem. A couple of the ramps are steep, but the employees are eager to help, and readily available. The only way to the beach are stairs. We tried it one day, and it was just too hard. It would be nice if there was a ramp access, but for the handicapped, even if you get there, you're going to have a tough time in the sand anyway. The rooms are nice, although a couch for relaxing would be a good addition. We had a great balcony... unfortunately, it overlooked the outdoor evening steak cookout, so the smoke was so bad, we had to shut our door. The only other area that definitely needs improvement is the shower water temp; switches from very hot to cold every day. Again, the service is 5 star, the food is 4 star, the privacy and enjoyment is 5 star, and the location for a peaceful getaway is also 5 star. If someone wants to be close to the famous Cancun drinking bars this is not the place... but it is for adults only, most of which were couples or family members... very few "wild" ones. There are activities by the pool each day, and shows every night (we didn't attend, but I hear they are nice). Also, part of the all inclusive includes being able to go to any other Palace resort. Though we didn't take advantage of this, it's a great benefit. Remember, it is SMALL... more like a boutique hotel; perfect for us. If you are looking for lots of shops, more activities, water slides, big gardens... this is NOT for you. Finally, the city bus stops right outside the hotel door, and makes it very easy to get to shopping, etc. for 65 cents a trip. The Timeshare folks are not too overbearing, as they can be at some hotels. I would definitely enjoy anothe visit to the Sun Palace.
reviews.title: Delightful getaway

likes.liked: — Compact in size and great service
likes.disliked: — hot/cold water for shower; room was OK not the greatest ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned last night from our 5 day, 4 night stay at the Sun Palace. This was our 2nd all inclusive trip and first trip to Mexico. We had an absolutely wonderful time. The room and hotel grounds were impeccable and SO CLEAN!! There are always people working and cleaning everything. Our sweet housekeeper kept our room immaculate and fridge stocked, she even made swans with rose petals out of our towels on the bed! The staff was very friendly and it is clear that customer service it at the top of their list. We got room service for breakfast 2 of our 4 days and each time something was delivered to the room, it was followed by a follow up phone call to make sure everything was to our liking. The room is stunning and I felt like we were practically in the ocean, the view was so amazing. Nice pools, lots of lounge chairs on the beach, and they have waitstaff that brings drinks and food if you wish right to you. I never had to wait too long for a drink at all. The food was very good, the restaurants had a gourmet flair to them which was a nice touch. There are 4 restaurants, we ate at them all and had to say that 'The steak' was our favorite, but we love food on an open grill. The other restaurants were great too. The Italian restaurant had a nice wine list. Overall it was a great trip, very relaxing and we would definitely visit the sun palace again.
reviews.title: Loved the Sun Palace

likes.liked: — Location and friendly service, great food
likes.disliked: — Bed was a little hard, but I still slept wonderfully

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from our 3rd trip to Riviera Maya. The first 2 times we stayed at the Palace Aventura Spa with another couple. This year, we went to Sun Palace in the hotel zone.
reviews.title: Sun "Paradise"

likes.liked: — Compact in size and great service
likes.disliked: — hot/cold water for shower; room was OK not the greatest ever.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Transportation - from the airport was 15 minutes (compared to 55 minutes to Aventura).
reviews.title: Sun Palace: Best all-inclusive ever!
Paradise - with a few buts!
reviews.text: Check-in - we arrived at 11:30 am and was treated to the usual personal service. We were taken from the lobby to the Lobby Bar and given a personal checkin.

description: As the first couples' only resort in Cancun, Sun Palace is the perfect retreat from the every day stress. This oasis for couples lies along the coast overlooking the turquoise Caribbean Sea. Conveniently located at just 15 minutes from the airport, this property provides service and amenities of the highest level. We invite you to enjoy this old favorite in a whole new way. A stunning coast line serves as a dramatic backdrop for this recently renovated resort featuring 252 richly appointed guestrooms. Five restaurants and three bars cater to a full range of tastes and moods. Golf enthusiasts can play all year round at the nearby Moon Spa & Golf Club which houses the only Jack Nicklaus Signature golf course in Cancun. Expert hands deliver spa services to those who seek a serene and rejuvenating experience.
